components.description:
A white cane, used by some people who are blind or visually impaired. The cane has a black or gray handle with a wrist loop, a white middle section, and a red end with a white cap. This cane differs from a support cane and is sometimes called a probing cane.

ðŸ‘©‍ðŸ¦¯ Woman With Probing Cane and ðŸ‘¨‍ðŸ¦¯ Man With Probing Cane are ZWJ sequences that use White Cane.
components.title: Probing Cane

version.description: Unicode 12.0 was released on March 5, 2019. Emojis that require new code points for release are listed on this page. See Emoji 12.0 for the full 2019 emoji list. More about this update.

apple_vendor_description: The white cane emoji on Apple devices is rendered with a clean, polished look, showcasing its bright white shaft and the typical red tip designed for visibility and safety. Appleâ€™s signature realistic lighting and soft 3D shading give it a tactile quality, emphasizing its importance as a tool for navigation and independence. This emoji on Apple devices serves as a clear and respectful symbol of visual impairment, accessibility, and the journey of those who are blind or have low vision.
